sentences.sContent: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.

sentences.sContent: exercises that expand the chest muscles
...our current smartphone lifestyle will expand to create our own smart home lifestyle too...
...world looks to expand modern energy access to the billion or so people without it...
...As some countries expand operations in Antarctica...
...Nations are also pressing ahead with space research and satellite projects to expand their global navigation abilities...
...improve educational opportunities and medical insurance and expand social security...
...But Bowman's supporters argue that Monsanto is trying to expand the scope of patents in ways that would enrich big corporations and hurt small farmers...
...The space dreamers end up benefiting all of us-not just because of the way they expand human knowledge...
...What does Tracey Weber think is the best way to expand c-textbook sales...
...we hope to expand the frontiers of human knowledge...
